Hydras/Perceptor/Darkhawk

Hydras watched the battle carfully and he frowne=
d, that hesitation didnt like it. He typed some instuctions to Parceptor wh=
ose started to move towards the lab. Afther type soem buttons, the pod that=
 held Nighlight's sunk and the floor close over her. Perceptor moved toward=
s the Hydras's throne


From: Super Cyclonus 
Sent: Thursday, February 18, =
2010 6:11 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/Bl=
ackFortress


  
>" I'm sure you wouldn't have wanted to do this either Opt=
imus, and 
>I can see why that sometimes the hardest lessons are learned wh=
en you face an 
>enemy upon who has been your comrade for many years. But i=
f this were you, I 
>trust you would do the same."

For a moment, as Rodimu=
s stood there before this somewhat smaller Autobot there was a brief moment=
 of clarity, a small instant of indecision. This Autobot showed a bravery a=
nd strength that seemed oddly familiar to him. 

>" All right, have it your=
 way Rodimus. This is going to hurt me 
>more than it will hurt you." 

How=
ever the moment passed as the dark Predacon shell programming that twisted =
his own kicked in. He smiled, as he cracked his knuckles, "You're right, th=
is is *will* hurt you more than it will hurt me." Rodimus replied in mockin=
g tones. 

With a quick motion he stepped foward to snap a quick punch towa=
rds Tuscon's head, ready to end this battle with this little upstart Autobo=
t - there was something about him that annoyed him!

In the meantime Cyclon=
us and Scourge had stepped back; watching the opening of the battle with lo=
oks of eagerness as they studied the moves of both combants.

(TAG)

Presto=
n
(Cyclonus/Scourge/Rodimus)
